Detailed Description

Enumerated Domain base class.

This class provide a unified abstract interface for implementing enumerated domains. It especially provide a way to ease and unify the access methods and input/output for all the domain of this kind.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

virtual bool TREX::transaction::DomainBase::equals ( DomainBase const &  other  )  const [pure virtual, inherited]

Equality test.

Parameters:
other Another instance

Checks if current instance is identical to other. This generally means that both have the same type and exactly the same possible values. In that sense it is more restrictive than the intersect method.

Return values:
true if current instance is identical to other
false otherwise
See also:

boost::any TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::getElement ( size_t  i  )  const [pure virtual]

generic element access

Parameters:
i index of the element

This method give access to the element i of the domain.

Precondition:
i is less than the size of the set
Returns:
the element at index i encapsulated on the boost::any class
See also:
size_t getSize() const

This is an overloaded member function, provided for convenience. It differs from the above function only in what argument(s) it accepts.

virtual size_t TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::getSize (  )  const [pure virtual]

element count

This method gives access to the number of elements in this instance.

Returns:
the number of values associated to this domain
Note:
by convention if the returned value is 0, TREX will consider this domain as full

template<class Ty , bool Safe>
Ty TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::getTypedElement ( size_t  n  )  const [inline]

Typed element access.

Template Parameters:
Ty expected return type
Safe extraction method
Parameters:
i index of the element

This method give access to the element i of the domain converted in the type Ty. The Safe flag indicate whether the conversion to Ty should be done using boost::any_cast -- which will fail if the encapsulated type is not Ty -- or using the safer string_cast that should be more type robust

Precondition:
i is less than the size of the set
if Safe is false, the underlying type of the container has to be exactly Ty
if Safe is true the string value of this element should be parseable into Ty
Returns:
the element at index i converted to the type Ty
Note:
No matter what this method is heavy in term of computation overhead and should be used wisely (mostly for debugging/instrumentation purpose)
See also:
size_t getSize() const
boost::any getElement(size_t i) const
std::string getStringValue(size_t i) const

Definition at line 137 of file BasicEnumerated.hh.

template<class Ty , bool Safe>
Ty TREX::transaction::DomainBase::getTypedSingleton (  )  const [inline, inherited]

singleton value

Template Parameters:
Ty output type
Safe robust conversion

This methods give acces to the value of a singleton instance The output will be of type Ty

The Safe parameter indicates which method should be used.

  • If the real type of the underneath domain type is guaranteed to be Ty the Safe can be false for performance
  • If the type is not guaranteed to be Ty but its text representation is compatible with Ty the Safe should be true
Precondition:
the instance is a singleton
the type of the value manip[ulated by this domain should be convertible to Ty or exactly Ty is Safe is false
Exceptions:
DomainAccess the insatnce was not a singleton
boost::bad_string_cast Safe is true and the value of the singleton cannot be parse into Ty
boost::bad_string_cast Safe is false and the type of the singleton is not Ty
Returns:
The singleton value of this domain
See also:
getStringSingleton() const
getSingleton() const

virtual bool TREX::transaction::DomainBase::intersect ( DomainBase const &  other  )  const [pure virtual, inherited]

check for common values

Parameters:
other another instance

This methods indicates if current instance share values with other. This generally means that both have the same type and that one can safely restrict the domain of the other.

Return values:
true if current instance shares values with other
false otherwise
See also:
bool equals(DomainBase const &other) const
DomainBase &restrictWith(DomainBase const &other)

bool TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::isEnumerated (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Check for enumerated domain.

This method check if the domain is based on an enumerated representation. In which case its representation is based on the list of all the possible values.

Return values:
true if the domain is enumeration based
false otherwise
See also:
bool isInterval() const

Implements TREX::transaction::DomainBase.

bool TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::isFull (  )  const [inline, virtual]

check for full domain

This method identifies if current domain is full. A full domain is adomain that includes al the possibles values for its type.

Return values:
true if current instance is full
false otherwise

bool TREX::transaction::BasicEnumerated::isInterval (  )  const [inline, virtual]

Check for interval domain.

This method is used to identify if this domain is an interval based domain. In which case it is represented by a lower and upper bound.

Return values:
true if the domain is interval based
false otherwise

std::ostream & BasicEnumerated::toXml ( std::ostream &  out,
size_t  tabs 
) const [virtual]

XML conversion.

Parameters:
out An output stream
tabs indentation level

This methods writes an XML representation of the domain into the output stream out. The tabs attribute indicates the indentation level expected for the tags.

Note:
To ensure compatibility this method should produce an xml output which is compatible with the XML parsing constructor of this domain.
Returns:
out after the operation
See also:
